item.title: Banning Host Flooding problem !PLEASE READ! 317 delta
item.dc:creator: @dagger9090 dagger9090
item.description:
@dagger9090 wrote:

So I posted about this a little while back and didnt receive any answer but I really need this and someone must know how to remove it without my server erroring or atleast make it work right.

Whats happening is if i log out and log right back on it will automatically ban me and say BANNING HOST flooding

or if it lags and i log right back on it will always do the same thing, then when i restart the server it is okay to log back on.

Here is the code this is what i didnt post last time and i think its why no one could really help.

[code] public void banHost(String host, int num) {
if (false) {
banned.add(host);
} else {
try {
misc.println(“BANNING HOST " + host + " (flooding)”);
banned.add(host);
delay = 12000;
delayUpdate = System.currentTimeMillis() + 60000;
} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

}

public boolean checkHost(String host) {
	for (String h : banned) {
		if (h.equals(host))
			return false;
	}
	int num = 0;
	for (String h : connections) {
		if (host.equals(h)) {
			num++;
		}
	}
	if (num > 1) {
		banHost(host, num);
		return false;
	}

	if (checkLog("ipbans", host)) {
		System.out.println("They are in ip ban list!");
		return false; // ip ban added by bakatool
	}
	return true;
}[/code]

What I want is for it to not do that at all and not work,
or work right and not at all the way it does.
Someone must be able to help me with this.

Read full topic
